text: Fredy Schmidtke (1 July 1961 â€“ 1 December 2017) was a German track cyclist. He won a gold medal in the 1000 metres time trial at the 1984 Summer Olympics. He also finished eighth in the sprint event at that Olympics. He was born in Worringen, Cologne. Schmidtke died of a heart attack on 1 December 2017, at the age of 56. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1961 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:German cyclists Category:Olympic gold medalists for Germany Category:Sportspeople from Cologne
title: Fredy Schmidtke
